text: Bambassi (native name: Màwés Aasʼè) is an Omotic Afroasiatic language spoken in Ethiopia around the towns of Bambasi and Didessa in the area east of Asosa in Benishangul-Gumuz Region. The parent language group is the East Mao group. Alternative names for the language are Bambeshi, Siggoyo, Amam, Fadiro, Northern Mao, Didessa and Kere. The most current information on the number of Bambassi speakers is not known, as the 2007 census grouped the Mao languages together, despite low lexical similarity. 33,683 mother tongue speakers of Maogna (covering Bambassi, Hozo and Seze) were listed.Ethiopia 2007 Census __NOTOC__ == Similarities == Bambassi has a 31% lexical similarity with other Omotic languages. == Phonology == Bambassi has 5 vowels: /a, e, i, o, u/. The vowels have lengthened forms, and Bambassi has contrastive vowel length. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+Consonants ! colspan="2" rowspan="2" | ! colspan="2" |Bilabial ! colspan="2" |Alveolar ! rowspan="2" |Postalveolar ! rowspan="2" |Palatal ! colspan="2" |Velar ! rowspan="2" |Glottal |- !plain !ejective !plain !ejective !plain !ejective |- ! rowspan="2" |Stop !voiceless |p |pʼ |t |tʼ | | |k |kʼ | |- !voiced |b | |d | | | |g | | |- ! colspan="2" |Affricate | | | |t͡sʼ |(t͡ʃ) | | | | |- ! rowspan="2" |Fricative !voiceless | | |s | |ʃ | | | |h |- !voiced | | |z | | | | | | |- ! colspan="2" |Nasal |m | |n | | | |ŋ | | |- ! colspan="2" |Approximant | | |l | | |j |w | | |- ! colspan="2" |Flap | | |ɾ | | | | | | |} == Notes == == Further reading == *Ahland, Michael. 2009.
